This game is, as far as i'm concerned, a modern homage to Masters of Orion 2 (from 1995, which i still play in a DOS emulator). It's mostly a streamlined take on that game (e.g. far fewer racial special abilities), but it's not lacking depth (e.g. each and every ship can be customized and there is some degree of micro-management necessary to keep one's population fed). This isn't a MOO2 clone, to be clear, but that game's influence is definitely prevalent, in a good way, and has been improved upon (e.g. multiple smaller Guardian-style ships instead of a single monolithic one). The rich UI can take a bit of getting used to, but it is quite elegant (far, far more-so than MOO3's was), providing easy access to all levels of interface with a minimal number of clicks. Auto-saving makes it easy to hop in and out of the game and several manual-save slots make it easy to experiment and roll back to a "known-good" state. The only thing missing is the classic MOO2 soundtrack.

Love this game. You really captured the spirit of the old classic 4x games. I especially like the ability to set different difficulty levels and the choice to select your own race bonuses. I have some feedback and improvement requests: 1) Add a Race symbol on ship icon in "ship in route" screen - This will make it easier to tell who is attacking your planets. 2) Add ship experience points - This will let individual ships get bonuses the more they are used. It will also make it worthwhile to refit an old ship instead of sacrificing it to the nearest enemy. 3) Add ship captains - Captains with added bonuses or abilities will give ships even more customization and help make the AI enemies tougher in the MID game turns. 4) I noticed that Blockaded planets do not rebuild destroyed Torpedo Turrets Overall this is a fantastic game and it makes time fly when you are stuck waiting for your friends or family.

rushed and perhaps a little too much for release as you're only two guys.

work you have put in. I would easily pay $3 and I'm sure with some more 
improvement most others would willingly pay since it's only two dollars 
more. Make the improvements, charge us $3, triple your profits, and release

content: I love everything about this game.  BUT 4 stars because of the following:  1. Replay is low.  The same strategy (alliances, focus on farming and farming tech) seems to work on every map / race.  2. WAY too much micro.  By midgame, I'm just annoyed by the clicking and the game starts to slow down, making it even more annoying.  Auto build is okay, but makes a lot of poor choices.  Ship editing is cool, but super tedious as I have to edit each one, every time a new tech is out.  Perhaps a quick "upgrade all ship designs to this tech" button after the tech is done.  Sending population to new colonies is also tedious.  Change the send population screen to allow you to quickly select a from and a to in one screen without finding the from planet on the map.  Or offer the menu automatically when you settle a new planet?  3. Lack of a manual.  I don't even know what an outpost is for after 4 victories.... electricity seems somewhat meaningless.  4. Try to make V2 a focus on shorter, less grindy games.  The tech tree could be half as long and it would be a better game.  I'd rather focus more on fleets, battles and exploration.

The best 4X game on Android. Maybe needs some more techs, but the developer does state more things will be added in the future. Awesome game, really enjoying it. Please support the developer, we need more games like this. Also I think the game is too cheap, I would be prepared to pay more for a quality game like this.

Love this game! I hope you create some sort of a wiki page though as it was kind of confusing at first. Also, is it possible to add more differences in technology/ships between races? I've played all races and I dont feel any difference aside from the pictures. The race perks just dont seem to have much of an impact to me. Maybe some races have ships with more powerful lasers or AoEs. maybe some can have more gold buildings. i know this might cause balancing issues but i feel better than having to use the same ships every time. Also can we have an option to create teams during start up? I know we can forge alliances but I dont think AI's do it with other AI's. This is so we get the option to go 1 vs 2... or 1 vs All.
replyContent:
Thanks for the review and feedback! Yeah we probably should start a wiki page. We do have a Reddit, Facebook and YouTube page/channels, so if you have any more questions or suggestions you can let us know there.

I would like to add more to the differences of the races. We'll see what we can do. I love the idea about teams. Hopefully add it soon.
